intro: Mecardonia tenuis, commonly known as the slender mecardonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Mecardonia tenuis is relatively hardy and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
